extends AbstractPresentationService
implements AuthenticationServiceFacade

    • Method Detail

      • authenticatePrincipal

        public void authenticatePrincipal(String principal,
                         List<String> credentials)
        Used by jUnit tests to create a security context to call operations and for a principal to be obtained by those operations.
        Specified by:
        authenticatePrincipal in interface AuthenticationServiceFacade

      • authenticatePrincipal

        public AuthorizationDataVO authenticatePrincipal(String username,
                                        String password)
        Takes the username and password as provided and checks the validaty of the credentials. Spring security is used to check the credentielas and to return the authenticated principal with it's authorized roles. An exception is thrown if the authentication failes.
        Specified by:
        authenticatePrincipal in interface AuthenticationServiceFacade
        Parameters:
        username - String containing the username of the principal to login
        password - String containing the password used to identify the current user
        Returns:
        AuthorizationDataVO object containing the name of the principal and the authorized roles.

      • getAuthorities

        public List<String> getAuthorities()
        Specified by:
        getAuthorities in interface AuthenticationServiceFacade

      • getPrincipal

        public String getPrincipal()
        Specified by:
        getPrincipal in interface AuthenticationServiceFacade

      • getXSRFSessionToken

        public String getXSRFSessionToken()
        Geneates a cross site request forgivery token, saves it at the current session and returns the token to the frontend site. This method is intercepted by the spring gwtrpc controller
        Specified by:
        getXSRFSessionToken in interface AuthenticationServiceFacade
        Returns:
        String object with cross site request forgivery generated token for current session

      • isPrincipalAuthenticated

        public boolean isPrincipalAuthenticated()
        Checks if the current user is authenticated by evaluating the SecurityContext
        Specified by:
        isPrincipalAuthenticated in interface AuthenticationServiceFacade
        Returns:
        Boolean true if the current user is authenticated and false elsewise
